This can include using eco-friendly materials, reducing energy and water consumption, and minimizing the use of chemicals and other pollutants.

2. Recycling and reusing materials: Reebok can also incorporate a closed-loop system in its manufacturing processes, where waste materials are recycled and reused as inputs for new products. This can help reduce the amount of waste that ends up in landfills.

3. Donating or repurposing waste materials: Reebok can also donate excess materials to organizations or initiatives that can repurpose them for different uses, such as making clothing or building materials. This can help reduce the overall amount of waste generated and promote sustainability.
